item.title: Katherine add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "If your life is a leaf that the seasons tear off and condemn they will bind you with love that is graceful and green as a stem." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Katherine add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Two people in love, alone, isolated from the world, that's beautiful." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Here's to the few who forgive what you do, and the fewer who don't even care" -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Children show scars like medals. Lovers use them as a secrets to reveal. A scar is what happens when the word is made flesh." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Never make a decision when you need to pee." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Don't call yourself a secret unless you mean to keep it." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description:
"Well I see you there with the rose in your teeth One more thin gypsy thief Yes, and thanks, for the trouble you took from her eyes I thought it was there for good so I never tried.
And Jane came by with a lock of your hair She said that you gave it to her That night that you planned to go clear" -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Katherine add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Katherine add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Anne Stuart
item.description: "She tried to allow herself only one biting remark an hour, and she had already overstepped her allowance." -- Anne Stuart

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley
item.description: "Nothing is so painful to the human mind as a great and sudden change." -- Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Mary Wollstonecraft
item.description: "I do not wish them [women] to have power over men; but over themselves." -- Mary Wollstonecraft

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Mary Wollstonecraft
item.description: "[I]f we revert to history, we shall find that the women who have distinguished themselves have neither been the most beautiful nor the most gentle of their sex." -- Mary Wollstonecraft

item.title: Katherine add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Pete Hamill
item.description: "He tried to imagine the sound of the color red." -- Pete Hamill

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Eugene O'Neill
item.description: "It was a great mistake, my being born a man, I would have been much more successful as a seagull or a fish. As it is, I will always be a stranger who never feels at home, who does not really want and is not really wanted, who can never belong, who must be a little in love with death!" -- Eugene O'Neill

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Eugene O'Neill
item.description: "None of us can help the things life has done to us. They’re done before you realize it, and once they’re done they make you do other things until at last everything comes between you and what you’d like to be, and you’ve lost your true self forever." -- Eugene O'Neill

item.title: Katherine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.
